Fales Library and Special Collections
Nelson Sullivan Video Collection
Sullivan, Nelson
MSS.357
12 Linear Feet
1976 - 1989 Nelson Sullivan (1948-1989) was a video artist who documented downtown New York City in the 1980s. The Nelson Sullivan Video Collection contains videorecordings, film, photographic material, and objects relating to the city's art world and LGBT community as well as performances in clubs, house parties, and interactions with Sullivan's friends from 1976-1989.
Arrangement
The archivist preserved the original order of the video collection as donated by the estate of Nelson Sullivan. The series of videorecordings have not been chronologically or thematically rearranged.
Biographical Note
Nelson Sullivan (1948-1989) was a video artist who documented downtown New York City in the 1980s. Originally from South Carolina, Sullivan moved to Manhattan in the 1970s and began filming the city's art world and gay scene. He captured John Sex, Sylvia Miles, RuPaul, and other performers at downtown bars and nightclubs including Danceteria, the Limelight, Palladium, and the Pyramid Club. Sullivan also chronicled house parties at his apartment at 5 Ninth Avenue in the Meatpacking District, gallery openings, park and street festivals, conversations with taxi drivers, and the ruminations of his friends including fashion designer Alexis Del Lago and journalist Michael Musto on film. He recorded almost 2,000 hours of tape, at first using a VHS-loading camera and later an 8mm video camera. Sullivan's filmmaking is recognizable for its point of view transitions and its stream-of-consciousness narration. He also often pointed a wide-angle lens at his own face while filming to record his commentary on the people, performances, or events that he captured. Sullivan made films up until his death from a heart attack on July 4, 1989.
Sources:
A Very Short Introduction to Nelson Sullivan (http://merepseudbloged.wordpress.com/2010/02/20/a-very-short-introduction-to-nelson-sullivan/)
The 5 Ninth Avenue Project (http://www.youtube.com/user/5ninthavenueproject/about)
John Sanchez Interview with Dick Richards about Nelson Sullivan (http://www.bettyjack.com/funtone/nelson/johnwithdick/)
Scope and Content
The Nelson Sullivan Video Collection is a collection of videorecordings made by video artist Nelson Sullivan (1948-1989). The collection consists of videotapes, film, photographic material and objects related to the city's art world and LGBT community as well as performances in clubs, house parties, and interactions with Sullivan's friends. The videos cover the period 1976-1989.
The collection is comprised of four series:
Series I: Videorecordings contains 8 boxes of videorecordings made by Nelson Sullivan.
Series II: Film (currently unavailable)
Series III: Photographic Material contains 1 binder of slides covering the period between 1975 and 1977.
Series IV: Objects (currently unavailable)
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open to researchers. Please contact the Fales Library and Special Collections, fales.library@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596.
Preferred Citation
Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date (if known); Nelson Sullivan Video Collection; MSS 357; unique identification number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.
Provenance
The Nelson Sullivan Video Collection was donated to Fales Library by the estate of Nelson Sullivan, overseen by Dick Richards, David Goldman, and Robert Coddington operating collectively as the 5 Ninth Avenue Project, in September 2012.
Related Material at Fales Library and Special Collections
April Palmieri Papers (MSS.115)
Downtown Flyers and Invitations (MSS.119)
Conditions Governing Use
Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder. Please contact the Fales Library and Special Collections, fales.library@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596.
Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
Access to some audiovisual materials in this collection is available through digitized access copies. Researchers may view an item's original container, but the media themselves are not available for playback because of preservation concerns. Materials that have already been digitized are noted in the collection's finding aid and can be requested in our reading room. To request an access copy, or if you are unsure if an item has been digitized, please contact special.collections@nyu.edu with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.
Other Finding Aids
Content notes are available in an external document. Created by New York University's Media Preservation Unit, the notes describe the content of the recordings as observed by a technician during digitization. These notes include: description of the action, recognizable names and locations, and screen captures. For access to this document, please contact the audiovisual archivist at Fales Library and Special Collections, fales.library@nyu.edu.

Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
Original Format: VHS
Scope and Content
Part one of this video from November 16, 1983, shows Nelson spending time in the Pyramid Club dressing room prior to a performance by the Atlanta, Georgia, band The Now Explosion. Among those in the video are Deloris French, John Sex, and members of The Now Explosion.
Part two of this video is a continuation of The Now Explosion performing at the Pyramid Club. After their performance, there is a dance contest with Doctor Tony and Joan Ransom from the PTA, then footage from the Pyramid Club dressing room after the show. Finally, there is footage of a party Nelson attends in "Bobby and John's" apartment.Chelsea Hotel (tape #1)ID: 357.0012November 20, 19831ID: 357.0012357.0012_pt.1357.0012_pt.2
Scope and Content
Original Tape 1 (of 2)
The first disc of this video starts with footage from the morning of November 20, 1983, when the Chelsea Hotel lobby is being prepared for a party. Nelson goes to room 604 to spend time with friends, including Sandy Dancer, Michael Musto, and Deloris French. Sandy Dancer prepares for her performance later in the day. When a news camera crew interviews Sandy, she says that the party is a birthday celebration for the Chelsea.
The second disc begins with people flowing in and out of room 604 while Sandy Dancer finishes preparing for her performance. There is a dance performance in the stairwell before the main party in the lobby, where, among others, Sandy Dancer and Michael Musto perform. Ed Koch appears after a couple songs in order to honor the Chelsea Hotel on its 100th anniversary and declare November 20, 1983 Chelsea Hotel Day. Koch also presents playwright Arthur Miller with a plaque honoring his time living at the Chelsea. Miller gives brief remarks before the unveiling of his plaque. Ulick O'Connor speaks on behalf of the history of the Chelsea, and there are a couple more performances.

Original Tape 2 (of 2)
This video documents performances and a party in the Chelsea Hotel lobby on November 20, 1983. Towards the end of the night, someone in the hotel accidentally pulls a fire alarm and everyone moves outside temporarily. Among those featured are Sandy Dancer, Sylvia Miles, and Cookie Mueller.

Scope and Content
The video starts with Nelson and friends driving to Pizza-a-Go-Go for White Trash Night on October 10, 1984. When they arrive, Nelson wanders around the building before Michael Musto and the Must's performance starts. He bumps into Musto in the dressing room getting ready and warming up. Then, Michael Musto and the Must perform covers of popular songs by girl groups. After the show, Nelson goes backstage with the musicians and others for a while before going to the kitchen, where a Beatles cover band is performing. Then, Nelson and friends drive around and end up in a cafe.

Scope and Content
Nelson and his friends get dinner near the Chelsea Hotel before heading to Limelight for a show on April 1, 1986. When they arrive at Limelight, Nelson records the performers getting ready to perform in the dressing room. Then he moves to the dancefloor to record the audience before Tabboo!'s puppet show. After that ends, Shazork (Lady Bunny, DJ Dmitri Brill, and Sister Dimension's band) takes the stage. After the show, Nelson heads back stage briefly before leaving Limelight and heading to the a restaurant, where the video ends.Atlanta: RuPaul at Weekends and Larry Tee's Celebrity ClubID: 357.0008February 19861ID: 357.0008357.0008

Scope and Content
The video starts with RuPaul gogo dancing at the Atlanta nightclub Weekends on February 27, 1986, then Nelson goes into RuPaul's private dressing room with Larry Tee and a couple of others. When RuPaul finishes his set, he joins the group. The video jumps to the next day, with Nelson spending time in a friend's house. His friend then gives him a tour on a drive through Atlanta on their way to lunch at Burton's Grill. The tour continues before they return to the house where Larry Tee and others have gathered to watch some recorded performances. Larry Tee then takes Nelson on a drive to what will become Larry Tee's Celebrity Club for a tour, which is still under construction. The video jumps again, to Nelson chatting with drag queens (Sultra, Wanda, and others) getting ready for the night and then doing a private performance/interview for Nelson. Finally, the video jumps to recordings of music videos by Spencer Thorton for The Now Explosion, RuPaul, and an unknown band. The video cuts off at the beginning of a clip titled "RuPaul, Tune-Up King."Atlanta #1ID: 357.0149August 16, 19835ID: 357.0149357.0149

Scope and Content
Nelson and Sylvia Miles attend a dialogue between sculptor Louise Nevelson and critic and editor of New Criterion Hilton Kramer at the Guggenheim in this video, dated March 5, 1986. The conversation is in celebration of Nevelson's being awarded The Great Artist Series Award by New York University's Gallatin Division, for her contribution to international art and culture. After the talk, Nelson and Sylvia go to the reception in the Guggenheim's rotunda, where they speak with Louise.Casanova by Ethyl EichelbergerID: 357.0011March 15, 19861ID: 357.0011357.0011

Scope and Content
Disc one of this video starts with Nelson receiving a phone call from Liz to make plans on March 15, 1986. Then Nelson spends time with his dog, Blackout, and his cats, Freddie and Eddie, telling them that it's his birthday. He takes Blackout for a short walk before heading to 7A Cafe to meet his friends, including Michael Musto. Nelson, Michael, and Liz then travel to Musto's family home.
In disc two, Nelson, Michael, and Liz finally arrive at the Musto's family home in Bensonhurst and chat with Michael's family. They then drive to Albert's new house, receive a tour, and eat dinner. Nelson, Michael, and Liz leave Albert's apartment, and the video ends with them in the car.

This DVD is divided into 3 parts:
Part 1 features Michael Musto and Larry T listening to musics and rapping on a street corner of New York.
Part 2 is a continuation of Nelson following his friends. He records his car ride with Larry T.
Part 3 allows us to get a tour of Nelson's bedroom, filled with a shoe and tie collection, oil painting supplies, and an editing center. Nelson and his friends then take a trip through a New York City park and bump into some acquaintances, Carey, Rose, and their baby Emily, while walking around.Bad BoysID: 357.0579June 20, 198621ID: 357.0579357.0579

While settled near Woodstock in Bearsville, NY, Nelson and his friends, Brant and Rhonda, are staying at the estate of Archipenko. After a brief tour the environment around their cottage, the video cuts to the following day where the group sets out to meet Frances Archipenko, the curator of the estate and the wife of the late artist, and Marshall and Eve Baer at the Rainbow Lodge. Scope and Content
[1] -- House Party & Twilight Zone, 6/19/1987 [2] -- Thanksgiving (part 2), 11/25/1987
Dated for June 19th, 1987, Nelson starts his night in an apartment with a group of friends, including Michael Musto, who are listening to music and playing the guessing game "What am I?". The video transitions to the group visiting the party downstairs. After going back upstairs to the main apartment, Nelson makes a plan to go home as his friends go to Cafe Sandino, while Michael Musto, James St. James, and Michael Angelo make their way to "The Tunnel" for the night. While back in his own apartment, Nelson talks to the camera face to face about his plan to visit Coney Island the following day. Nelson Talking
Existence and Location of Copies
DVD access copy available.
Scope and Content
At 11:30 pm on March 5th, the night starts with plans to visit Mars Bar for bingo night. Without hesitation to catch the light green sign that spells out "DRUGS", Nelson Sullivan filmed this particular footage for an HBO special at the "Mars Needs Bingo" event that happens once a month. Features Lahoma Van Zant, also referred to as "Bingo Carla", who is offered a part in a short film for the New York Lesbian & Gay Film and Video Festival. Later in the evening, the viewer is provided backstage access before a RuPaul dance and vocal performance during "Gay Night" at Mars Bar. The announcement of the passing of Steven Comb, who died from AIDs, was announced. Lastly, we are given the opportunity to experience backstage access after the show with a small cameo of Michael Musto.

Original format: Video8mmMarrs & then Nelson goes to PYRAMID to see BunnyID: 357.0601January 29, 198916ID: 357.0601357.0601_pt.1357.0601_pt.2
Marrs & then Nelson goes to PYRAMID to see Bunny
Scope and Content
Part one of this video entry provides its audience a chance to construct a vision of nightlife in New York. Nelson and his friends are on their way to The Pyramid Club to catch Lady Bunny's voice performance sets. This specific entry possesses footage of the entire first set and part of the second. Also features a drag performance of First Ladies Nancy Reagan and Barbara Bush doing a musical duet of "Bosom Buddies".
Part two of this video is a continuation of Lady Bunny's second performance at The Pyramid Club, along with a "Sister Dimensions" performance of an original poem. At the end of the show, after recording the ambiance of the backstage area and entire area of the venue, Sullivan ends his night by recording the streets of New York during his cab ride home, looking out of the windshield and focused on the surrounding neighborhood.

Pennsylvania -cocktails after Dove shoot, 10. Chrome Movie Film. 31091, 903.Annotated Film Containers1975-199019
Scope and Contents
Original film containers that held 8mm and Super8mm films shot by Nelson Sullivan (see cuids 6924-6982). Handwritten annotations are found on many of the containers.
Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
The films have been digitized, rehoused, and stored separately for conservation reasons. See cuid6924-cuid6982 for details about the content.Series III: Photographic MaterialSubseries A: Slides
Scope and Content
Slides include:
Building of Pyramids on the Beach of F.I.: Kodachrome 64; Eddie and Freddy, Fire Island, Pyramid Scenes: Kodachrome 64, 20 exps.; Fire Island, Eddie and Freddy: Kodachrome 64; Fire Island, Nelson Haircutting Seen: Kodachrome 25; From Roof at 5 9th Ave; Good Ice Palace, Inside and Out; July 4th 1976 Cherry Grove; Masako and Her Baby, Chelsea Street, Fire Island and Nelson: some good double exposure, Kodachrome 64; UntitledNelson's Slides 1975-771975-1977ASubseries B: Photographic PrintsPaula Gately Tillman Portrait of Nelson Sullivan1986A
